Mark Project Items to Separate Compiled Code Dialog Box

Requires: Base Development System

To display this dialog box, click the Mark Existing Items button on the Project page of the Project Properties dialog box. Use this dialog box to simultaneously separate compiled code from multiple existing items in a project.

This page includes the following components:

  • Items to be marked/unmarked—Lists the items in the project and whether they are marked for LabVIEW to separate compiled code the next time LabVIEW saves the item.
    • File—Includes the path to each item in the project. The icons allow you to identify when LabVIEW applies the changes you make in this dialog box.
      • —LabVIEW immediately applies changes you make to items with this icon because these items are on disk.
      • —You must save items with this icon after you close the dialog box because these items are currently in memory.
    • Status—Indicates whether the item is marked for LabVIEW to separate compiled code the next time LabVIEW saves the item.
  • Mark Selected Items—Separates compiled code from selected project items the next time LabVIEW saves the items. Refer to the icon next to each project item to determine the next time LabVIEW saves the item.
  • Unmark Selected Items—Includes compiled code in the selected project items the next time LabVIEW saves the items. Refer to the icon next to each project item to determine the next time LabVIEW saves the item.
  • Close—Closes the dialog box. LabVIEW applies any status changes at the following times:
    • Items in memory—The next time you save the item.
    • Items on disk—LabVIEW already applied the change as soon as you marked or unmarked the item.
